questions.question_text:
In what order would the following stages of the Information Cycle occur?
1 Transform Information
2 Create Value
3 Transform Knowledge

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
Information can be considered as being one stage in the ‘information cycle’ of an enterprise. In the information cycle
(figure 35), business processes generate and process data, transforming them into information and knowledge, and
ultimately generating value for the enterprise

Information > Knowledge > Value

From ISACA materials:
 Skills and competence are required to perform process activities and take decisions in organisational structures.
Conversely, some processes are aimed at supporting the life cycle of skills and competencies

questions.question_text: Which attribute applies to a Process Activity?

choices.D: Provides statements of actions to deliver benefits

questions.question_text: What do Processes produce as a result of their operation?

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
• Processes produce, and also require, service capabilities (infrastructure, applications, etc.).

B. From the ISACA materials:
• Relationships with other enablers—The links with other enablers include:
– Information is one of the service capabilities, and service capabilities are leveraged through processes to deliver
internal and external services.

questions.question_text: What service capability is leveraged through processes to deliver internal and external services?

Identify the missing word in the following sentence.
Governance is about [?] and deciding amongst different stakeholders" value interests.
